description: Grants entitlements to an existing flow.

parameters.name: Entitlements
parameters.description: The list of entitlements that you want to grant. (dict) --- The entitlements that you want to grant on a flow. DataTransferSubscriberFeePercent (integer) --- Percentage from 0-100 of the data transfer cost to be billed to the subscriber. Description (string) --- A description of the entitlement. This description appears only on the MediaConnect console and will not be seen by the subscriber or end user. Encryption (dict) --- The type of encryption that will be used on the output that is associated with this entitlement. Allowable encryption types: static-key, speke. Algorithm (string) --- The type of algorithm that is used for the encryption (such as aes128, aes192, or aes256). ConstantInitializationVector (string) --- A 128-bit, 16-byte hex value represented by a 32-character string, to be used with the key for encrypting content. This parameter is not valid for static key encryption. DeviceId (string) --- The value of one of the devices that you configured with your digital rights management (DRM) platform key provider. This parameter is required for SPEKE encryption and is not valid for static key encryption. KeyType (string) --- The type of key that is used for the encryption. If no keyType is provided, the service will use the default setting (static-key). Region (string) --- The Amazon Web Services Region that the API Gateway proxy endpoint was created in. ResourceId (string) --- An identifier for the content. The service sends this value to the key server to identify the current endpoint. The resource ID is also known as the content ID. The ARN of the role that you created during setup (when you set up MediaConnect as a trusted entity). SecretArn (string) --- The ARN of the secret that you created in Secrets Manager to store the encryption key. This parameter is required for static key encryption and is not valid for SPEKE encryption. Url (string) --- The URL from the API Gateway proxy that you set up to talk to your key server. EntitlementStatus (string) --- An indication of whether the new entitlement should be enabled or disabled as soon as it is created. If you don't specify the entitlementStatus field in your request, MediaConnect sets it to ENABLED. Name (string) --- The name of the entitlement. This value must be unique within the current flow. The Amazon Web Services account IDs that you want to share your content with. The receiving accounts (subscribers) will be allowed to create their own flows using your content as the source. (string) ---

nested_params.name: DataTransferSubscriberFeePercent
nested_params.description: Percentage from 0-100 of the data transfer cost to be billed to the subscriber.

nested_params.name: Description
nested_params.description: A description of the entitlement. This description appears only on the MediaConnect console and will not be seen by the subscriber or end user.

nested_params.name: Encryption
nested_params.description: The type of encryption that will be used on the output that is associated with this entitlement. Allowable encryption types: static-key, speke.

nested_params.name: Algorithm
nested_params.description: The type of algorithm that is used for the encryption (such as aes128, aes192, or aes256).

nested_params.name: ConstantInitializationVector
nested_params.description: A 128-bit, 16-byte hex value represented by a 32-character string, to be used with the key for encrypting content. This parameter is not valid for static key encryption.

nested_params.name: DeviceId
nested_params.description: The value of one of the devices that you configured with your digital rights management (DRM) platform key provider. This parameter is required for SPEKE encryption and is not valid for static key encryption.

nested_params.name: KeyType
nested_params.description: The type of key that is used for the encryption. If no keyType is provided, the service will use the default setting (static-key).

nested_params.name: Region
nested_params.description: The Amazon Web Services Region that the API Gateway proxy endpoint was created in. This parameter is required for SPEKE encryption and is not valid for static key encryption.

nested_params.name: ResourceId
nested_params.description: An identifier for the content. The service sends this value to the key server to identify the current endpoint. The resource ID is also known as the content ID. This parameter is required for SPEKE encryption and is not valid for static key encryption.

nested_params.name: RoleArn
nested_params.description: The ARN of the role that you created during setup (when you set up MediaConnect as a trusted entity).

nested_params.name: SecretArn
nested_params.description: The ARN of the secret that you created in Secrets Manager to store the encryption key. This parameter is required for static key encryption and is not valid for SPEKE encryption.

nested_params.name: Url
nested_params.description: The URL from the API Gateway proxy that you set up to talk to your key server. This parameter is required for SPEKE encryption and is not valid for static key encryption.

nested_params.name: EntitlementStatus
nested_params.description: An indication of whether the new entitlement should be enabled or disabled as soon as it is created. If you don't specify the entitlementStatus field in your request, MediaConnect sets it to ENABLED.

nested_params.name: Name
nested_params.description: The name of the entitlement. This value must be unique within the current flow.

nested_params.name: Subscribers
nested_params.description: The Amazon Web Services account IDs that you want to share your content with. The receiving accounts (subscribers) will be allowed to create their own flows using your content as the source.

parameters.name: FlowArn
parameters.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the flow that you want to grant entitlements on.

nested_items.name: Entitlements
nested_items.description: The entitlements that were just granted.

nested_items.name: DataTransferSubscriberFeePercent
nested_items.description: Percentage from 0-100 of the data transfer cost to be billed to the subscriber.

nested_items.name: Encryption
nested_items.description: The type of encryption that will be used on the output that is associated with this entitlement.

nested_items.name: Algorithm
nested_items.description: The type of algorithm that is used for the encryption (such as aes128, aes192, or aes256).

nested_items.name: ConstantInitializationVector
nested_items.description: A 128-bit, 16-byte hex value represented by a 32-character string, to be used with the key for encrypting content. This parameter is not valid for static key encryption.

nested_items.name: DeviceId
nested_items.description: The value of one of the devices that you configured with your digital rights management (DRM) platform key provider. This parameter is required for SPEKE encryption and is not valid for static key encryption.

nested_items.name: KeyType
nested_items.description: The type of key that is used for the encryption. If no keyType is provided, the service will use the default setting (static-key).

nested_items.name: Region
nested_items.description: The Amazon Web Services Region that the API Gateway proxy endpoint was created in. This parameter is required for SPEKE encryption and is not valid for static key encryption.

nested_items.name: ResourceId
nested_items.description: An identifier for the content. The service sends this value to the key server to identify the current endpoint. The resource ID is also known as the content ID. This parameter is required for SPEKE encryption and is not valid for static key encryption.

nested_items.name: RoleArn
nested_items.description: The ARN of the role that you created during setup (when you set up MediaConnect as a trusted entity).

nested_items.name: SecretArn
nested_items.description: The ARN of the secret that you created in Secrets Manager to store the encryption key. This parameter is required for static key encryption and is not valid for SPEKE encryption.

nested_items.name: Url
nested_items.description: The URL from the API Gateway proxy that you set up to talk to your key server. This parameter is required for SPEKE encryption and is not valid for static key encryption.

nested_items.name: EntitlementStatus
nested_items.description: An indication of whether the entitlement is enabled.

nested_items.name: Subscribers
nested_items.description: The Amazon Web Services account IDs that you want to share your content with. The receiving accounts (subscribers) will be allowed to create their own flow using your content as the source.

nested_items.name: FlowArn
nested_items.description: The ARN of the flow that these entitlements were granted to.
